sense.name: an amount to counterbalance an opposite amoun
sense.examples: These costs are offsets against taxable profits. Unrealized losses cannot be used as an offset on income.

sense.name: a measured distance from a given poin
sense.examples: The wheels had an offset of nearly four inches. How many inches of offset do I need on the left to center this picture on the wall? Something is causing a small offset in the current coming from this outlet.

sense.name: an offshoot or runner from a plant
sense.examples: Sally trimmed back the offsets from her leggy houseplants. Put the offset in water until it forms roots, then plant it in soil.

sense.name: a printing technique using plates to transfer ink
sense.examples: In offset printing, the ink is first transferred from a metal plate to a rubber surface and from there to a paper surface.

sense.name: a bend in a pipe to get around an obstacle
sense.examples: The hot water pipe in the basement has an offset to get around a low support beam in the ceiling. The metal pipes in the lab had many offsets to go around other large pieces of equipment.

sense.name: the commencement or beginning of something
sense.examples: Mary liked her boss from the offset. From the offset it was never a successful venture.

sense.name: a narrowed displacement of a wall which forms a ledge
sense.examples: The high wall had an offset where people could sit while waiting for the bus.
